alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 3:07AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Des Moines and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Lee, Des Moines, Henderson and Hancock Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Dubuque, Jo Daviess and Jackson Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. .Melting snowpack in the upper Midwest will increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Dubuque. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.5 feet, Water affects the Illinois Central railroad tracks in Dubuque. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to 20.8 feet Sunday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued late this morning.
